p: The E protein has a single TM domain and a relatively short N-terminal CP endodomain, whereas M has three TM domains and a much larger C-terminal CP endodomain. It has been suggested that both CP endodomains play a significant role in the critical functions of these proteins in assembly and release of new viral particles [ 28, 31]. The E protein also acts as an ion channel, an activity that has been associated with its TM domain [ 32, 33]. In SARS-CoV, this activity is not essential for replication, but it appears to be required for virulence [ 34].
